section.p: Containers allow designers to seamlessly integrate modules from many different developers into a cohesive website design. Containers can also include visual elements that allow website users to interact with the module.

ul.li: You can have a default container, which would be overridden by individual panes or modules if they provide their own style definitions.
You can use different containers in a single page.
You can mix and match any container with any CSS.

step.cmd: Create a new file for the container.

ul.li: The container must contain exactly one pane called ContentPane.
The single pane must be defined as a server control by adding runat="server" to the element.
